nodes.heading: Part B Definitions
nodes.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part B Definitions

nodes.name: Carcinoma-in-situ
nodes.description: A histologically proven, localized pre-invasion lesion where cancer cells have not yet penetrated the basement membrane or invaded surrounding tissues.

nodes.name: TNM Staging
nodes.description: A classification method for tumors, including Carcinoma-in-situ.

nodes.name: FIGO
nodes.description: Staging method of the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique.

nodes.heading: Early Stage Cancer
nodes.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part B Definitions > Early Stage Cancer

nodes.name: Early Stage Cancer
nodes.description: The presence of one of the following malignant conditions: Tumour of the thyroid histologically classified as T1N0M0, Prostate tumour classified as TNM T1a, T1b, or T1c, Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia classified as RAI Stage I or II, Basal cell and squamous skin cancer that has spread to distant organs, Hodgkin's lymphoma Stage I.

nodes.name: Major Cancer
nodes.description: A malignant tumour characterised by the uncontrolled growth & spread of malignant cells with invasion & destruction of normal tissues.

nodes.heading: Pre-existing Disease
nodes.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part B Definitions > Pre-existing Disease

nodes.name: Pre-existing Disease
nodes.description: Any condition, ailment, injury or disease diagnosed by a physician within 48 months prior to the effective date of the policy.

nodes.name: Cancer Diagnosis Benefit
nodes.description: A lump sum benefit paid on diagnosis of cancer.

nodes.heading: b. Increased Benefit
nodes.section_path: SPACE FOR ENDORSEMENTS > Part C > b. Increased Benefit

nodes.name: Premium Guarantee
nodes.description: The Premiums shall remain unchanged for a period of three years from the date of issuance of Policy.

nodes.name: IRDAI
nodes.description: Any revision in the Premium rates shall be notified to you at least three months prior to the date of such revision and you will be given a period of 30 days from Premium Due Date to renew the Policy.

edges.evidence: We are glad to inform you that your proposal has been accepted and the HDFC Life Cancer Care Policy ('Policy') being this Policy, has been issued.
In case you are not satisfied with our response, you can also approach the Insurance Ombudsman in your region.
This document is the evidence of a contract between HDFC Life Insurance Company Limited and the Policyholder as described in the Policy Schedule given below.
Note: Kindly note that name of the Company has changed from "HDFC Standard Life Insurance Company Limited" to "HDFC Life Insurance Company Limited".
- 4) Company, company, Insurer, Us, us, We, we, Our, our -means or refers to HDFC Life Insurance Company Limited.
This Policy shall be governed by the laws of India and the Indian Courts shall have jurisdiction to settle any disputes arising under the Policy.
We are required to obtain prior approval from the IRDAI before making any material changes to these provisions, except for changes of regulatory / statutory nature.
The customer can contact us on the below mentioned address or at any of our branches in case of any complaint/ grievance: Grievance Redressal Officer HDFC Life Insurance Company Limited.

edges.target: entity:insurance regulatory and development authority of india act, 1999
edges.relation: receives complaints or disputes relating to
edges.evidence: The Ombudsman shall receive and consider complaints or disputes relating to- delay in settlement of claims, beyond the time specified in the regulations, framed under the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India Act, 1999;

Any person who has a grievance against the Company, may himself or through his legal heirs, nominee or assignee, make a complaint in writing to the Insurance Ombudsman within whose territorial jurisdiction the branch or office of the Company complained against or the residential address or place of residence of the complainant is located.
- 2) Assignee - means the person to whom the rights and benefits under this Policy are transferred by virtue of assignment under section 38 of the Insurance Act, 1938; as amended from time to time;
Assignment or transfer of a policy should be in accordance with Section 38 of the Insurance Act, 1938 as amended by Insurance Laws (Amendment) Act, 2015.
Provisions regarding policy not being called into question in terms of Section 45 of the Insurance Act, 1938, as amended by Insurance Laws (Amendment) Act, 2015 dated 23.03.2015 are as follows:

the person named by the Policyholder (who is also the Life Assured) under this policy and registered with us in accordance with the Nomination Schedule, who is authorized to receive the Death Benefit under this Policy, on the death of the Life Assured.
The benefits covered under the policy are determined by the Plan Option chosen by the Policyholder.
This Benefit will be available in case the Policyholder has chosen the Gold or Platinum Plan Option.
This Benefit will be available only in case the Policyholder has chosen the Platinum Plan Option.
The Policyholder can assign or transfer of a Policy in accordance with Section 38 of the Insurance Act, 1938 as amended from time to time.
The Policyholder can nominate a person/ persons in accordance with Section 39 of the Insurance Act, 1938 as amended from time to time.
The onus of intimation of change of address lies with the Policyholder.
the proceeds under the policy shall become payable to policyholder or nominee(s) in the event of assignee or transferee dying before the insured
The policyholder of a life insurance on his own life may nominate a person or persons to whom money secured by the policy shall be paid in the event of his death.
Where the nominee is a minor, the policyholder may appoint any person to receive the money secured by the policy in the event of policyholder's death during the minority of the nominee.
the insurer should grant a written acknowledgement to the policyholder of having registered a nomination or cancellation or change thereof.
the age of the Life Assured as declared in the Proposal.
where the tumour is classified as Tis according to the TNM Staging method.
For purposes of this Policy, Carcinoma-in-situ must be confirmed by a biopsy.
Early Stage Cancer shall mean the presence of one of the following malignant conditions: ... (iii) Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia classified as RAI Stage I or II; ...
A lump sum benefit, as per the table below, will be paid on diagnosis of: - Carcinoma-in-situ or Malignant cancer
Upon the completion of three Policy years, the Premiums may be revised by us subject to IRDAI's approval.
...or the regulations, circulars, guidelines or instructions issued by the IRDAI from time to time...

Currently, the application for the revival should be made within five years from the due date of the first unpaid Premium and before the expiry of the Policy Term. The revival will be subject to satisfactory evidence of good health being provided by the Life Assured and payment of outstanding Premiums with interest.
The benefits under this product are portable as per IRDAI (Health Insurance) Regulation, 2016.
The Company has calculated the Premiums under the Policy on the basis of the age of the Life Assured as declared in the Proposal.
the Grievance Redressal Officer's name who will be handling the complaint of the customer.
he or she may contact our Grievance Redressal Officer within 8 weeks of the receipt of the communication at any of the touch points mentioned in the document.

edges.evidence: The provisions of Section 39 are not applicable to any life insurance policy to which Section 6 of Married Women's Property Act, 1874 applies or has at any time applied except where before or after Insurance Laws (Amendment) Act, 2015, a nomination is made in favour of spouse or children or spouse and children whether or not on the face of the policy it is mentioned that it is made under Section 39.

The transfer or assignment shall not be operative as against an insurer until a notice in writing of the transfer or assignment and either the said endorsement or instrument itself or copy thereof certified to be correct by both transferor and transferee or their duly authorised agents have been delivered to the insurer.
In case of refusal to act upon the endorsement by the Insurer, any person aggrieved by the refusal may prefer a claim to IRDAI within 30 days of receipt of the refusal letter from the Insurer.
In case of refusal to act upon the endorsement by the Insurer, any person aggrieved by the refusal may prefer a claim to IRDAI within 30 days of receipt of the refusal letter from the Insurer.

No Insurer shall repudiate a life insurance Policy on the ground of Fraud, if the Insured / beneficiary can prove that the misstatement was true to the best of his knowledge and there was no deliberate intention to suppress the fact or that such mis-statement of or suppression of material fact are within the knowledge of the insurer.
...no life insurance policy would have been issued to the insured.
